Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the study actually found that asymptomatic people did transmit the virus.
Understate: The claim understates the potential for asymptomatic individuals to spread the virus, as the study only looked at household transmission and not community spread.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide a link to the study and ignores several caveats included in the article.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that the study's findings apply to all situations, when it only focused on household transmission.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores alternative explanations and logical leaps made in the portrayal of the journal article on social media.
